intro: Spiraea ningshiaensis, commonly known as the Ningshia Valley spiraea, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pink flowers. The plant typically blooms in early spring, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat. Its leaves are ovate and have a smooth texture, turning yellow in the fall. Spiraea ningshiaensis is often found in rocky or well-drained soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
